nodes.message: TODO: If Shawn has already claimed credit for the Drat Invasion.

nodes.text: There was a noticeable lack of Dire Rats around the school today. Rumor has it that it was a Rogue who stopped the infestation. Would anyone care to verify the truth of the rumor?
With the help of my friends, I discovered that the cause of the problem was the Queen Drat who lived down in the dungeon under the castle. I forced her to stop the Drats from coming into the castle.
With the help of my friends, I discovered a giant Drat Queen that lurked under the castle was controlling all the other Drats. Once I defeated her, all the other Drats scattered.
Very good, Herr O'Conner. See me after class in my office and we shall discuss this matter further.
I will remind all of you that the final is in two days. Study well. I expect you all to do well.
Good day.
I did, sir. I destroyed a giant Drat Nest in the dungeon and stopped the Dire Rats from coming into the castle.
Liar! The Drats didn't stop coming because you destroyed some nest - the Drats stopped because I dealt with the Drat Queen herself.
You're just jealous because you were too scared to face a few Drats.
Silence! I will not have bickering in this classroom.
Unless one of you can provide proof of your statements, then neither of you will be credited with the deed.
You will discuss the matter fully in my office after class.
So where was this Drat Nest in the dungeon - the Torture Chamber? The Golem room? Funny how I didn't see any sign of you or a nest when I was down there dealing with the Drat Queen.
It was... it was... in a crypt past a secret door...
Oh, do you mean Jamus' crypt? Or maybe Hans' crypt? Funny how their ghosts didn't mention to me that they saw you down there.
No... it was... it was an empty crypt in a different section of the dungeon...
Oh, my mistake. Here I thought that I had stopped the Drat invasion by dealing with the Drat Queen. Silly me.
Enough of this! If you wish to convince me which of you actually stopped the Dire Rat menace, speak with me after class in my office.
Very good, Herr Sosi. It seems that you have a very good chance at becoming 'Rogue of the Year' for such heroic actions on your part.
Liar!
Shawn stopped the Queen Drat!
Master von Urwald - Shawn was the one who stopped the invasion, not Signore Sosi. I can attest to it.
Indeed? Herr O'Conner - did you, in fact, stop the Drat Invasion?
Yes, sir.
Then perhaps you should take a lesson from this incident. If you do not speak up for yourself, someone else will claim credit for your actions.
Sir, if I don't speak up for my actions, I have friends who will.
So you do.
I will remind all of you that the final is in two days. Study well. I expect you all to do well.
Good day.
There was a noticeable lack of Dire Rats around the school today. Rumor has it that it was a Rogue who stopped the infestation. Would anyone care to verify the truth of the rumor?
Thomas and I stopped Drats, sir.

It turns out that the Queen of the Dire Rats had lost something valuable to her. That's why the Dire Rats were searching in the castle. We recovered it for her and she agreed to keep the Dire Rats out of the castle.
We found the cause of the Dire Rat infestation and put a stop to it.
Very good. You both took the initiative to solve a dangerous problem - and you proved that a Rogue can be as heroic as any Paladin.
Thank you, sir.

I will remind you all that in two days, you will have the final exam of this semester. This will determine whether or not you belong at this school. If you do not do well, you will not be returning next semester.
Now that the distraction of the Dire Rats is over, I suggest you spend this afternoon mastering your lessons.
Good afternoon.
